main event: An officer reported seeing a brilliant white light descending rapidly toward the southeast before reversing direction and climbing straight up out of sight.
interesting points: The light appeared to be 30-40 feet in diameter and was located at approximately 1000 feet of altitude., The total observation duration was about 10-15 seconds., Officer A was the sole witness as Officer B was in a separate vehicle., The sighting occurred on a clear night with good visibility., It is suggested that two smaller objects following the star Alpha Aquilae might have been satellites.
witness description: Officer A who was on patrol in the area
